Class GuessNumber

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.JPanel
GuessNumber
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class GuessNumber
extends javax.swing.JPanel
A JPanel that creates a game to guess a number. The minimum and maximum possible integers are set by MIN_VALUE and MAX_VALUE. When the user enters a number and hits return or presses the guess button the game checks if the guess is correct. If it's incorrect then it tells the user whether it was too high or too low and if the user has made a previous guess then the background will change to blue if the guess was closer or red if the guess was further than the previous guess. Once the user guesses correctly the background will change to green and all inputs will be disabled except for a new game button that will appear. If the user presses the new game button a new number will be generated, the new game button will disappear and the game will reset.
Author:
Wil Simpson
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Method Details

    • getGuess

      public int getGuess()
      Gets the guess from the textfield input
      Returns:
      integer guess

    • processGuess

      private void processGuess()
      Processes a given request by taking the number from the textfield. Handles incorrect values for textfield. Changes the background color to blue if the current guess is closer than the previous guess and gives a hint whether the current guess is too high or too low.

    • newGame

      public void newGame​(boolean toggleView)
      Generates a new number, sets the previous guess to null, resets the text and label fields, sets the background to the default color and logs the new number to guess to the console.
      Parameters:
      toggleView - whether the view should toggle

    • getRandomNumber

      public final int getRandomNumber​(int min, int max)
      Gets a random int inclusively between the given min and max
      Parameters:
      min - minimum value that can be returned
      max - maximum value that can be returned
      Returns:
      random value inclusively between min and max

    • setGuessLabel

      public void setGuessLabel​(java.lang.String text)
      Sets the guess label to the given string
      Parameters:
      text - new text to set to

    • isGuessHigh

      public boolean isGuessHigh​(int guess)
      Checks whether the given guess is higher or equal to the number
      Parameters:
      guess - guess that was made
      Returns:
      whether the guess was higher or equal to the number

    • makeGuess

      public GuessResult makeGuess​(int guess)
      Makes a guess given a number. Sets the previous guess to the given guess and returns true if the guess is closer, false if the guess is farther and null if this is the first guess.
      Parameters:
      guess - new guess that was made
      Returns:
      whether the guess was closer or farther

    • isCloser

      public GuessResult isCloser​(int guess)
      Checks whether the current guess is closer than the previous guess. If the guess is the same distance then it will return true
      Parameters:
      guess - new guess
      Returns:
      whether the new guess is closer than the previous

    • toggleView

      private void toggleView()
      Switches views for playing a game and asking to play a new game. The new game button is always invisible when the other components are enabled and vice-versa.

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Checks if the game is over by seeing if the new game button is visible
      Returns:
      whether the game is over

    • getNumber

      public int getNumber()
      Gets the number the user is currently guessing for
      Returns:
      number user is guessing for
